name: Accorder Paladin
text: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
flavor: "I fight for the suns, the surface, and everything in between."
title: Accorder Paladin

name: Ardent Recruit
text: Metalcraft — Ardent Recruit gets +2/+2 as long as you control three or more artifacts.
flavor: "We lost our homes and our kin. We won't let those rotters take our future as well."
title: Ardent Recruit

name: Banishment Decree
text: Put target artifact, creature, or enchantment on top of its owner's library.
flavor:
"Unworthy of consecration."
—Axsh, lesser cenobite
title: Banishment Decree

name: Black Sun's Zenith
text: Put X -1/-1 counters on each creature. Shuffle Black Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
flavor:
"Under the suns, Mirrodin kneels and begs us for perfection."
—Geth, Lord of the Vault
title: Black Sun's Zenith

name: Bladed Sentinel
text: {W}: Bladed Sentinel gains vigilance until end of turn.
flavor: The Mirran partisans created hundreds of patrol sentinels to divert Phyrexian assaults from the Tangle.
title: Bladed Sentinel

name: Blightsteel Colossus
text:
Trample, infect, indestructible
If Blightsteel Colossus would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, reveal Blightsteel Colossus and shuffle it into its owner's library instead.
title: Blightsteel Colossus

name: Blightwidow
text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
title: Blightwidow

name: Blisterstick Shaman
text: When Blisterstick Shaman enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: A productive warren requires a good deal of prodding.
title: Blisterstick Shaman

name: Blue Sun's Zenith
text: Target player draws X cards. Shuffle Blue Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
flavor:
"The Origin Query will wait. We must ensure we survive to return to it."
—Pelyus, vedalken ordinar
title: Blue Sun's Zenith

name: Bonehoard
title: Bonehoard

name: Brass Squire
text: {T}: Attach target Equipment you control to target creature you control.
flavor:
"I admire it. Few pull off pluck and subservience at the same time."
—Ezuri, renegade leader
title: Brass Squire

name: Burn the Impure
text: Burn the Impure deals 3 damage to target creature. If that creature has infect, Burn the Impure deals 3 damage to that creature's controller.
flavor: Flame doesn't kneel to Phyrexia.
title: Burn the Impure

name: Caustic Hound
text: When Caustic Hound dies, each player loses 4 life.
flavor: At first, the Mirrans aimed for its exposed gut. The survivors quickly learned to do otherwise.
title: Caustic Hound

name: Choking Fumes
text: Put a -1/-1 counter on each attacking creature.
flavor:
"Fall to your knees and welcome our embrace."
—Qal-Sha, Priest of Norn
title: Choking Fumes

name: Concussive Bolt
text:
Concussive Bolt deals 4 damage to target player.
Metalcraft — If you control three or more artifacts, creatures that player controls can't block this turn.
flavor: Shock one, awe the rest.
title: Concussive Bolt

name: Consecrated Sphinx
text:
Flying
Whenever an opponent draws a card, you may draw two cards.
flavor: Blessed by the hands of Jin-Gitaxias.
title: Consecrated Sphinx

name: Contested War Zone
text:
Whenever a creature deals combat damage to you, that creature's controller gains control of Contested War Zone.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 until end of turn.
title: Contested War Zone

name: Copper Carapace
text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
flavor:
"We will fight as they do: our flesh protected behind metal."
—Tae Aquil, Viridan weaponsmith
title: Copper Carapace

name: Core Prowler
text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
When Core Prowler dies, proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)
title: Core Prowler

name: Corrupted Conscience
text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature has infect. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
flavor: Karn's creation is now his master.
title: Corrupted Conscience

name: Creeping Corrosion
text: Destroy all artifacts.
flavor:
"We will reveal the futility of their heresy by showing them how fragile their relics are."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger
title: Creeping Corrosion

name: Crush
text: Destroy target noncreature artifact.
flavor: A golem's hands know no tenderness.
title: Crush

name: Cryptoplasm
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have Cryptoplasm become a copy of another target creature. If you do, Cryptoplasm gains this ability.
flavor:
"If left in the enemy's shape too long, it might be lost to them."
—Vy Covalt, Neurok agent
title: Cryptoplasm

name: Darksteel Plate
flavor:
"If there can be no victory, then I will fight forever."
—Koth of the Hammer
title: Darksteel Plate

name: Decimator Web
text: {4}, {T}: Target opponent loses 2 life, gets a poison counter, then puts the top six cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
flavor: Mycosynth grew unfettered beneath the black lacuna, metastasizing into a matrix of noxious energy.
title: Decimator Web

name: Distant Memories
text: Search your library for a card, exile it, then shuffle your library. Any opponent may have you put that card into your hand. If no player does, you draw three cards.
flavor:
"The fleeting shadows of his primitive self have all but vanished."
—Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur
title: Distant Memories

name: Divine Offering
text: Destroy target artifact. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.
flavor:
"The Phyrexians are vulnerable. Do not despair. We will prevail!"
—Juryan, rebel leader
title: Divine Offering

name: Dross Ripper
text: {2}{B}: Dross Ripper gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Such a creation serves no purpose other than exterminating every one of us."
—Sadra Alic, Neurok strategist
title: Dross Ripper

name: Fangren Marauder
text: Whenever an artifact is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may gain 5 life.
flavor:
"The fangren fight without comfort of any kind. We can ask no less of ourselves."
—Tilien, Sylvok partisan
title: Fangren Marauder

name: Flayer Husk
title: Flayer Husk

name: Flensermite
text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
title: Flensermite

name: Flesh-Eater Imp
text:
Flying
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Sacrifice a creature: Flesh-Eater Imp gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
title: Flesh-Eater Imp

name: Frantic Salvage
text:
Put any number of target artifact cards from your graveyard on top of your library.
Draw a card.
flavor: "We will mourn when there is time. For now, we survive."
title: Frantic Salvage

name: Fuel for the Cause
text: Counter target spell, then proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)
flavor: "Your ideas will be discarded and your will repurposed."
title: Fuel for the Cause

name: Galvanoth
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of your library. If it's an instant or sorcery card, you may cast it without paying its mana cost.
flavor: It chews open Mirrodin's husk and feeds on the outpouring of energy.
title: Galvanoth

name: Glissa's Courier
text: Mountainwalk
flavor:
"So, the survivors from Oxid Ridge are on the move. Let them come and witness predation in its purest form."
—Glissa
title: Glissa's Courier

name: Glissa, the Traitor
text:
First strike, deathtouch
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, you may return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
title: Glissa, the Traitor

name: Gnathosaur
text: Sacrifice an artifact: Gnathosaur gains trample until end of turn.
flavor: Mirran creatures that could withstand the Phyrexian oil found an abundance of crunchy snacks.
title: Gnathosaur

name: Go for the Throat
text: Destroy target nonartifact creature.
flavor: Having flesh is increasingly a liability on Mirrodin.
title: Go for the Throat

name: Goblin Wardriver
text: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
flavor:
"A true warrior fights with whatever's handy."
—Qerk of the Secret Warren
title: Goblin Wardriver

name: Gore Vassal
text: Sacrifice Gore Vassal: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. Then if that creature's toughness is 1 or greater, regenerate it.
flavor:
"Rid them of their unfaithful organs. Bring new hearts to the unbelievers."
—Tome of Machines, verse 1703
title: Gore Vassal

name: Green Sun's Zenith
text: Search your library for a green creature card with converted mana cost X or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. Shuffle Green Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
flavor: As the green sun crowned, Phyrexian prophecies glowed on the Tree of Tales.
title: Green Sun's Zenith

name: Gruesome Encore
text: Put target creature card from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. It gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step. If that creature would leave the battlefield, exile it instead of putting it anywhere else.
title: Gruesome Encore

name: Gust-Skimmer
text: {U}: Gust-Skimmer gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: Phyrexian smog clouds choked the skies, threatening creatures who couldn't comprehend the menace below.
title: Gust-Skimmer

name: Hellkite Igniter
text:
Flying, haste
{1}{R}: Hellkite Igniter gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of artifacts you control.
flavor: Its flight sets the sky itself on fire.
title: Hellkite Igniter

name: Hero of Bladehold
text:
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Whenever Hero of Bladehold attacks, put two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield tapped and attacking.
title: Hero of Bladehold

name: Hero of Oxid Ridge
text:
Haste
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Whenever Hero of Oxid Ridge attacks, creatures with power 1 or less can't block this turn.
title: Hero of Oxid Ridge

name: Hexplate Golem
flavor:
"Use everything. Iron, rust, scrap . . .  even the ground must join our cause."
—Ezuri, renegade leader
title: Hexplate Golem

name: Horrifying Revelation
text: Target player discards a card, then puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
flavor:
"Ours is a glorious transmission! Behold a future where all bow to the Father of Machines."
—Isila, Priest of Sheoldred
title: Horrifying Revelation

name: Ichor Wellspring
text: When Ichor Wellspring enters the battlefield or is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.
flavor:
"Our glorious infection has taken hold."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite
title: Ichor Wellspring

name: Inkmoth Nexus
text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}: Inkmoth Nexus becomes a 1/1 Blinkmoth artifact creature with flying and infect until end of turn. It's still a land. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
title: Inkmoth Nexus

name: Into the Core
text: Exile two target artifacts.
flavor:
"They believe they're driving us back, but we're leading them to their doom."
—Kethek, furnace stoker
title: Into the Core

name: Kemba's Legion
text:
Vigilance
Kemba's Legion can block an additional creature for each Equipment attached to Kemba's Legion.
flavor: The squabble over succession was quickly replaced by the struggle to survive.
title: Kemba's Legion

name: Knowledge Pool
text:
Imprint — When Knowledge Pool enters the battlefield, each player exiles the top three cards of his or her library.
Whenever a player casts a spell from his or her hand, that player exiles it. If the player does, he or she may cast another nonland card exiled with Knowledge Pool without paying that card's mana cost.
title: Knowledge Pool

name: Koth's Courier
text: Forestwalk
flavor: Koth sent partisans into the Tangle to bring survivors to the safe haven of the tunnels below Kuldotha.
title: Koth's Courier

name: Kuldotha Flamefiend
text: When Kuldotha Flamefiend enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice an artifact. If you do, Kuldotha Flamefiend deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
title: Kuldotha Flamefiend

name: Kuldotha Ringleader
text:
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Kuldotha Ringleader attacks each turn if able.
flavor: Being surrounded by goblins is less objectionable when they're fighting for you.
title: Kuldotha Ringleader

name: Lead the Stampede
text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal any number of creature cards from among them and put the revealed cards into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
title: Lead the Stampede

name: Leonin Relic-Warder
text:
When Leonin Relic-Warder enters the battlefield, you may exile target artifact or enchantment.
When Leonin Relic-Warder leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
title: Leonin Relic-Warder

name: Leonin Skyhunter
text: Flying
flavor: "The infection has spread farther than we could glimpse from the heights of Taj-Nar."
title: Leonin Skyhunter

name: Loxodon Partisan
text: Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
flavor: "This war is not about loxodon or leonin, Sylvok or Auriok. To defeat these rotters, we must do it together."
title: Loxodon Partisan

name: Lumengrid Gargoyle
text: Flying
flavor:
"Anything that watches without sleep and fights without fear is a valuable ally against the Phyrexians."
—Kara Vrist, Neurok agent
title: Lumengrid Gargoyle

name: Magnetic Mine
text: Whenever another artifact is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Magnetic Mine deals 2 damage to that artifact's controller.
title: Magnetic Mine

name: Massacre Wurm
text:
When Massacre Wurm enters the battlefield, creatures your opponents control get -2/-2 until end of turn.
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, that player loses 2 life.
title: Massacre Wurm

name: Master's Call
text: Put two 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature tokens onto the battlefield.
flavor: The need to obey was inscribed on every plate in their bodies.
title: Master's Call

name: Melira's Keepers
text: Melira's Keepers can't have counters placed on it.
flavor: Her warriors are the last defense against the coming storm.
title: Melira's Keepers

name: Metallic Mastery
text: Gain control of target artifact until end of turn. Untap that artifact. It gains haste until end of turn.
flavor:
"All will be reforged in the fires of glory."
—Urabrask the Hidden
title: Metallic Mastery

name: Mirran Crusader
text: Double strike, protection from black and from green
flavor: A symbol of what Mirrodin once was and hope for what it will be again.
title: Mirran Crusader

name: Mirran Mettle
text:
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
Metalcraft — That creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn instead if you control three or more artifacts.
flavor: "Our land will not yield to Phyrexian corruption!"
title: Mirran Mettle

name: Mirran Spy
text:
Flying
Whenever you cast an artifact spell, you may untap target creature.
flavor: Accurate information is a precious commodity in times of war.
title: Mirran Spy

name: Mirrorworks
text: Whenever another nontoken artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {2}. If you do, put a token that's a copy of that artifact onto the battlefield.
flavor: The faces of Geth's corpse-dredgers are disturbingly similar.
title: Mirrorworks

name: Mitotic Manipulation
text: Look at the top seven cards of your library. You may put one of those cards onto the battlefield if it has the same name as a permanent. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
flavor:
"They can't even comprehend nature. How could they improve it?"
—Venser
title: Mitotic Manipulation

name: Morbid Plunder
text: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: Even the dead are raw materials for the Phyrexian vision of perfection.
title: Morbid Plunder

name: Mortarpod
title: Mortarpod

name: Myr Sire
text: When Myr Sire dies, put a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
flavor: For the Phyrexians, death is not an end, nor a one-time occurrence.
title: Myr Sire

name: Myr Turbine
text:
{T}: Put a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
{T}, Tap five untapped Myr you control: Search your library for a Myr creature card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
title: Myr Turbine

name: Myr Welder
text:
Imprint — {T}: Exile target artifact card from a graveyard.
Myr Welder has all activated abilities of all cards exiled with it.
flavor: Memnarch designed some myr to follow the levelers and reaffix lost parts. Mirran partisans put that instinct to good use.
title: Myr Welder

name: Nested Ghoul
text: Whenever a source deals damage to Nested Ghoul, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
flavor:
"The chest cavity is cleared of useless meat. I know just what to do with the space."
—Gyed, Vault Priest
title: Nested Ghoul

name: Neurok Commando
text:
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Whenever Neurok Commando deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.
flavor: "There's no more time for secluded study. Answers are there only for those with the courage to take them."
title: Neurok Commando

name: Oculus
text: When Oculus dies, you may draw a card.
flavor:
"In its gaze I saw no mercy, no recognition that I was worthy to exist."
—Kara Vrist, Neurok agent
title: Oculus

name: Ogre Resister
flavor: He didn't have a word for "home," but he knew it was something to be defended.
title: Ogre Resister

name: Peace Strider
text: When Peace Strider enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
flavor:
"The Vanished must have sent it from beyond to aid us in this struggle."
—Kessla, Sylvok shaman
title: Peace Strider

name: Phyresis
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has infect. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
flavor:
"Perfection is at hand. You have been freed of weakness and made compleat."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One
title: Phyresis

name: Phyrexian Crusader
text:
First strike, protection from red and from white
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
title: Phyrexian Crusader

name: Phyrexian Digester
text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
flavor:
"Our cause will ripen in the fertile flesh of the unworthy."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One
title: Phyrexian Digester

name: Phyrexian Hydra
text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
If damage would be dealt to Phyrexian Hydra, prevent that damage. Put a -1/-1 counter on Phyrexian Hydra for each 1 damage prevented this way.
title: Phyrexian Hydra

name: Phyrexian Juggernaut
text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Phyrexian Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
flavor: Where nature impedes, Phyrexians overcome.
title: Phyrexian Juggernaut

name: Phyrexian Rager
text: When Phyrexian Rager enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
flavor:
"I believe many worlds will bow to Phyrexia. Mirrodin is merely the first."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One
title: Phyrexian Rager

name: Phyrexian Rebirth
text: Destroy all creatures, then put an X/X colorless Horror artifact creature token onto the battlefield, where X is the number of creatures destroyed this way.
flavor: As long as one drop of the oil exists, the joyous work continues.
title: Phyrexian Rebirth

name: Phyrexian Revoker
text:
As Phyrexian Revoker enters the battlefield, name a nonland card.
Activated abilities of sources with the chosen name can't be activated.
flavor: Basic senses like sight and taste are reserved for those in power.
title: Phyrexian Revoker

name: Phyrexian Vatmother
text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you get a poison counter.
title: Phyrexian Vatmother

name: Pierce Strider
text: When Pierce Strider enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 3 life.
flavor:
"Pain isn't a negative stimulus. Pain is a sign of your imperfection."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One
title: Pierce Strider

name: Piston Sledge
text:
When Piston Sledge enters the battlefield, attach it to target creature you control.
Equipped creature gets +3/+1.
Equip—Sacrifice an artifact.
flavor: Only the goblins could make a simple machine so complex.
title: Piston Sledge

name: Pistus Strike
text: Destroy target creature with flying. Its controller gets a poison counter.
flavor:
"Even a nuisance such as the pistus fly has a purpose in our new world."
—Glissa
title: Pistus Strike

name: Plague Myr
text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
flavor: They watch for a new master, one more sinister than the last.
title: Plague Myr

name: Plaguemaw Beast
text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)
flavor: Phyrexia's spiral of consumption grows ever wider and darker.
title: Plaguemaw Beast

name: Praetor's Counsel
text: Return all cards from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Praetor's Counsel. You have no maximum hand size for the rest of the game.
flavor: As the Phyrexian contagion corroded Karn's body, the praetors whispered psalms to corrupt his mind.
title: Praetor's Counsel

name: Priests of Norn
text:
Vigilance
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
flavor:
"May our blessings sever the tongues of the forsaken."
—Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite
title: Priests of Norn

name: Psychosis Crawler
text:
Psychosis Crawler's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
Whenever you draw a card, each opponent loses 1 life.
flavor:
"If that brain can't figure out the secret of the serum, then add more brains."
—Rhmir, Hand of the Augur
title: Psychosis Crawler

name: Quicksilver Geyser
text: Return up to two target nonland permanents to their owners' hands.
flavor:
"Phyrexians are tenacious. That's not the same thing as clever."
—Tezzeret
title: Quicksilver Geyser

name: Quilled Slagwurm
flavor: Vorinclex removed its teeth so it wouldn't waste time chewing before moving to the next kill.
title: Quilled Slagwurm

name: Rally the Forces
text: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.
flavor:
"Drive them back! Make their underworld into their grave!"
—Koth of the Hammer
title: Rally the Forces

name: Razorfield Rhino
text: Metalcraft — Razorfield Rhino gets +2/+2 as long as you control three or more artifacts.
flavor: Adapted to tread on razorgrass, the rhino proved adept at treading on Phyrexians as well.
title: Razorfield Rhino

name: Red Sun's Zenith
text: Red Sun's Zenith deals X damage to target creature or player. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead. Shuffle Red Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
title: Red Sun's Zenith

name: Rot Wolf
text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Rot Wolf this turn dies, you may draw a card.
title: Rot Wolf

name: Rusted Slasher
text: Sacrifice an artifact: Regenerate Rusted Slasher.
flavor:
"It's a beautiful vision. Discarded debris is reborn as a singular entity."
—Urabrask the Hidden
title: Rusted Slasher

name: Sangromancer
text:
Flying
Whenever a creature an opponent controls dies, you may gain 3 life.
Whenever an opponent discards a card, you may gain 3 life.
title: Sangromancer

name: Scourge Servant
text: Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
flavor:
"The union of the oil and necrogen has produced many pleasing reactions."
—Sheoldred, Whispering One
title: Scourge Servant

name: Septic Rats
text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Whenever Septic Rats attacks, if defending player is poisoned, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
title: Septic Rats

name: Serum Raker
text:
Flying
When Serum Raker dies, each player discards a card.
flavor: The serum from the blinkmoths they gather greases the joints of witch engines.
title: Serum Raker

name: Shimmer Myr
text:
Flash
You may cast artifact cards as though they had flash.
flavor: It evades Phyrexians by hiding in the spaces between seconds.
title: Shimmer Myr

name: Shriekhorn
text:
Shriekhorn enters the battlefield with three charge counters on it.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Shriekhorn: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
title: Shriekhorn

name: Signal Pest
text:
Battle cry (Whenever this creature attacks, each other attacking creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.)
Signal Pest can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.
flavor: It leaps from tree to tree, revealing the enemy's positions.
title: Signal Pest

name: Silverskin Armor
text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 and is an artifact in addition to its other types.
Equip {2}
flavor: Partisan spies warned that no armor would protect the body from Phyrexian infection. Neurok strategists took that as a challenge.
title: Silverskin Armor

name: Skinwing
title: Skinwing

name: Slagstorm
text:
Choose one —
• Slagstorm deals 3 damage to each creature.
• Slagstorm deals 3 damage to each player.
flavor:
"As long as we have the will to fight, we are never without weapons."
—Koth of the Hammer
title: Slagstorm

name: Sphere of the Suns
text:
Sphere of the Suns enters the battlefield tapped and with three charge counters on it.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Sphere of the Suns: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
title: Sphere of the Suns

name: Spin Engine
text: {R}: Target creature can't block Spin Engine this turn.
flavor:
"It will be battle-ready before our strike at Oxid Ridge, and it will guarantee our victory."
—Ketuc of the Helm
title: Spin Engine

name: Spine of Ish Sah
text:
When Spine of Ish Sah enters the battlefield, destroy target permanent.
When Spine of Ish Sah is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Spine of Ish Sah to its owner's hand.
title: Spine of Ish Sah

name: Spiraling Duelist
text: Metalcraft — Spiraling Duelist has double strike as long as you control three or more artifacts.
flavor: "I never move the same way twice. Those rotters can't grasp chaos."
title: Spiraling Duelist

name: Spire Serpent
text:
Defender
Metalcraft — As long as you control three or more artifacts, Spire Serpent gets +2/+2 and can attack as though it didn't have defender.
flavor: A mirror to draw its eye, a rod to rouse its rage, and a sword to break its bonds.
title: Spire Serpent

name: Spread the Sickness
text: Destroy target creature, then proliferate. (You choose any number of permanents and/or players with counters on them, then give each another counter of a kind already there.)
flavor: Life is ephemeral. Phyrexia is eternal.
title: Spread the Sickness

name: Steel Sabotage
text:
Choose one —
• Counter target artifact spell.
• Return target artifact to its owner's hand.
flavor:
"You are hopelessly obsolete, my brothers. Come and join the Great Work."
—Rhmir, Hand of the Augur
title: Steel Sabotage

name: Strandwalker
title: Strandwalker

name: Sword of Feast and Famine
title: Sword of Feast and Famine

name: Tangle Hulk
text: {2}{G}: Regenerate Tangle Hulk.
flavor:
"A true Phyrexian predator. It will never know death, just as nature intended."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger
title: Tangle Hulk

name: Tangle Mantis
text: Trample
flavor: The fiercest hunters in the Tangle don't seek out the mantises. They are the mantises.
title: Tangle Mantis

name: Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas
text:
+1: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal an artifact card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
−1: Target artifact becomes an artifact creature with base power and toughness 5/5.
−4: Target player loses X life and you gain X life, where X is twice the number of artifacts you control.
title: Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas

name: Thopter Assembly
text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control no Thopters other than Thopter Assembly, return Thopter Assembly to its owner's hand and put five 1/1 colorless Thopter artifact creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.
title: Thopter Assembly

name: Thrun, the Last Troll
text:
Thrun, the Last Troll can't be countered.
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate Thrun.
flavor: His crime was silence, and now he suffers it eternally.
title: Thrun, the Last Troll

name: Tine Shrike
text:
Flying
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
flavor: A new bird of prey—one that hunts sentience.
title: Tine Shrike

name: Titan Forge
text:
{3}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Titan Forge.
{T}, Remove three charge counters from Titan Forge: Put a 9/9 colorless Golem artifact creature token onto the battlefield.
title: Titan Forge

name: Training Drone
text: Training Drone can't attack or block unless it's equipped.
flavor:
"Vulshok flail, Viridian shield, loxodon blade . . . Tazzir, bring the Moriok hook and assemble the rookies."
—Vy Covalt, Neurok agent
title: Training Drone

name: Treasure Mage
text: When Treasure Mage enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost 6 or greater, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
title: Treasure Mage

name: Turn the Tide
text: Creatures your opponents control get -2/-0 until end of turn.
flavor:
"Let their mindless armies come and face the might of genius."
—Varil, Neurok partisan
title: Turn the Tide

name: Unnatural Predation
text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.
flavor:
"Domination by the strongest—that is all that matters in the Tangle now."
—Vorinclex, Voice of Hunger
title: Unnatural Predation

name: Vedalken Anatomist
text: {2}{U}, {T}: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. You may tap or untap that creature.
flavor: "Specimen 211 examination report. Observation: graft sublimation incomplete. Result: death. Prepare specimen 212."
title: Vedalken Anatomist

name: Vedalken Infuser
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a charge counter on target artifact.
flavor: "All plans begin as dreams. I intend to awaken them."
title: Vedalken Infuser

name: Victory's Herald
text:
Flying
Whenever Victory's Herald attacks, attacking creatures gain flying and lifelink until end of turn.
flavor: The corruption stirred the heavens above, awaking a shining champion.
title: Victory's Herald

name: Viridian Claw
text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0 and has first strike.
Equip {1}
flavor: "Phyrexians can't corrupt what they can't get close enough to touch."
title: Viridian Claw

name: Viridian Corrupter
text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
When Viridian Corrupter enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
title: Viridian Corrupter

name: Viridian Emissary
text: When Viridian Emissary dies, you may search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
title: Viridian Emissary

name: Virulent Wound
text: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. When that creature dies this turn, its controller gets a poison counter.
flavor: Sadly, the extent of Gerkk's healing knowledge was "don't pick at it."
title: Virulent Wound

name: Vivisection
text:
As an additional cost to cast Vivisection, sacrifice a creature.
Draw three cards.
flavor: Phyrexians research with the grace of surgeons and the finesse of butchers.
title: Vivisection

name: White Sun's Zenith
text: Put X 2/2 white Cat creature tokens onto the battlefield. Shuffle White Sun's Zenith into its owner's library.
flavor: After the Battle of Liet Field, the white sun crested above Taj-Nar, bringing hope to all who survived the carnage.
title: White Sun's Zenith
